topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a721246368725e5d540100#post_53a721246368725e5d540100
Probly because villains that actually do stuff are trying too hard at "being eeeeeeeeeeevil!"
Megamind and Dr. Evil are good examples of that.
And then you have villains like Discord and the Joker and all those chaos-theory freaks who might do stuff, but they really just don't give two shits bout nuthin
topics.author: 4fde0c7e945b706cc30003eb

topics.body:
"@CogWeaver":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a7271f6368726a807f0000#post_53a7271f6368726a807f0000
Not even that. I'm talking full-on lazy villains. Like, the only reason they're counted as a villain is because they associate with villains. Like pre-timeskip Kuzan from One Piece.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a727bb63687274979d0500#post_53a727bb63687274979d0500
I dunno if they'd get counted villains if all they had was association to other villains.  I'd think they'd have to do at least _one_ bad thing to get marked as a villain.
But I guess I haven't watched as many shows that would do that sort of thing.  That weird cat-thing that always asks people for contracts to turn them into witches comes to mind, but I don't really know what that's all about tbh.
topics.author: 4fde0c7e945b706cc30003eb
